Let $G$ be an $r$-partite graph with $n$ vertices in each part. If $G$ has minimum degree $\geq (r-\frac{3}{2}-o(1))n$ then $G$ must contain a $K_r$.



A conjecture of Bollob\'{a}s, Erd\H{o}s, and Szemer\'{e}di \cite{BES75b}, who proved that $r-\frac{3}{2}$ would be the best possible here.

This is true, and was proved by Haxell \cite{Ha01}. The sharp threshold of\[(r-1)n-\left\lceil \frac{sn}{2s-1}\right\rceil\]where $s=\lfloor r/2\rfloor$ was proved by Haxell and Szab\'{o} \cite{HaSz06}.




References


[BES75b] Bollob\'as, B. and Erd\H{o}s, P. and Szemer\'{e}di, E., On complete subgraphs of {$r$}-chromatic graphs. Discrete Math. (1975), 97--107.

[Ha01] Haxell, P. E., A note on vertex list colouring. Combin. Probab. Comput. (2001), 345--347.

[HaSz06] Haxell, Penny and Szab\'o, Tibor, Odd independent transversals are odd. Combin. Probab. Comput. (2006), 193--211.
